author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Ring in the new year with vaccines, experts urge as COVID, flu cases rise in Cook County
text:
Summary by Ground News Flu cases especially are sending more people to hospitals as winter temperatures plummet, families gather for the holidays and another brutal season of respiratory illness bears down on Chicago. Cook County residents should resolve to get vaccinated against COVID-19 and influenza. Only about 12% in Cook County have gotten a dose of the latest booster, which came out in September. author: Team Latestly
title: Canada Shocker: Shots Fired At House of Hindu Temple Presidentâ€™s Son in Surrey, Probe Launched | ðŸŒŽ LatestLY
text: Gunshots were fired at the residence of the son of a Hindu temple president in Surrey, in the Canadian province of British Columbia. In the wake of this unsettling incident, Canadian authorities are currently investigating the matter, details of which in media reports only include the efforts being made in the probe and do not confirm if any suspects have been identified. The incident occurred on December 27 at approximately 8:03 AM in the 14900 block of 80 Avenue. According to a statement from the Surrey Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP), the targeted residence belongs to the elder son of Satish Kumar, the president of the Lakshmi Narayan Mandir in Surrey. [Canada Shocker: Sikh Man and His 11-Year-Old Son Gunned Down in Targeted Shooting in Canadian City of Edmonton](https://www.latestly.com/world/canada-shocker-sikh-man-and-his-11-year-old-son-gunned-down-in-targeted-shooting-in-canadian-city-of-edmonton-5555079.html). Canada Crime News Breaking: Royal Canadian Mounted Police says it is investigating the incident; Says,"No one was injured during the incident, but the residence involved sustained damage consistent with bullet holes." author: Rob Manch
title: 'It's really easy to root for him': Athletic director, sports podcaster excited as Saquon Barkley joins Eagles | Southeastern Pennsylvania | wfmz.com
text: At Whitehall High School, you can still see Saquon Barkley's jersey commemorated on the football field, and you'll find signatures and pictures of Barkley in Athletic Director Bob Hartman's office. He said Barkley is a role model for students there. "It's really easy to root for him as a person as much as a football player, because he says and does the right things," said Hartman. Amazingly, Hartman said it wasn't immediately apparent back then that Barkley was going to be an offensive superstar. "His sophomore year, he didn't play a ton of varsity snaps on the offensive side of the ball. He played a little more defensively, then flourished after that. His junior year was really good, of course his senior year he was player of the year in Pennsylvania," said Hartman. Hartman said Barkley still comes back to run camps for aspiring athletes. "It's a youth camp for kids in the Lehigh Valley. It was a great success last year. He was there running around with the kids," said Hartman. And while Barkley is celebrating his new role on the Eagles, he has another award awaiting him at Whitehall. "He was here at the end of January for Hall of Fame night. One of his very good friends was inducted, and he'll get inducted here in short order. It's 10 years from graduation, so he's right around that number right now," said Hartman. But it's not just people in the Lehigh Valley excited to see Barkley in Eagles green. "He's a local kid, and it feels like he's coming back home," said Jeff Warren, host of the Philadelphia Sports Table podcast. Warren said you should prepare to see a lot more fans wearing Barkley's name. "You're going to see a lot of Saquon Barkley jerseys. If he does wear number 26, we're going to be seeing a lot of those jerseys," said Warren. Hartman said he just hopes Barkley's move to Philly will bring him around the Whitehall High School field a little more often. "If he can be around here just a little bit more, that's even better for our kids and our community, because he's such a good person," said Hartman. In his career as a Whitehall Zephyr, Barkley scored 63 touchdowns. Hartman said he hopes to see Barkley back on the field this summer teaching kids to do the same thing.

author: TNN
title: Maha Kumbh: Chandigarh to Prayagraj bus service flagged off
text:
Maha Kumbh: Chandigarh to Prayagraj bus service flagged off
With pics
Chandigarh: The Chandigarh Transport Undertaking (CTU) bus service from Chandigarh to Prayagraj for Maha Kumbh began operations from ISBT-17, Chandigarh, on Thursday.
The bus service was flagged off by Diprava Lakra, secretary finance and secretary transport, UT Chandigarh administration, in the presence of Pradhuman Singh, director transport-cum-divisional manager, CTU, and other officials of the administration.
"Maha Kumbh Mela, an iconic spiritual fair in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, is underway and will last until Feb 26. To facilitate devotees from Chandigarh and nearby areas, CTU has started a bus service from ISBT-17, counter no. 26, to Prayagraj via Delhi, Sikandrabad, and Kanpur," said a UT spokesperson.
HVAC (heating, ventilation, and air-conditioned) buses are plying on the route. The bus fare is Rs 1,662. The one-way journey will cover 919 km, with an estimated travel time of 19.25 hours.
Apart from this, CTU is providing bus services to various religious destinations in the neighbouring states of Punjab, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, Delhi, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, and Uttarakhand. The bus services are operating to various religious destinations like Ayodhya Dham, Salasar, Khatu Shyam, Vrindavan, Haridwar, Katra, Jwala Ji, and Chamunda Devi.
BOX
THE SCHEDULE
Departure: 12:00 hrs (daily)
Arrival at Prayagraj, Nehru Park: 07:25 hrs (next day)
Departure from Prayagraj: 17:00 hrs (daily)
Arrival time: 12:25 hrs (next day) at ISBT-17, Chandigarh
Online booking of seats until Feb 25 is available on https://ctuonline.chd.gov.in, https://chdctu.gov.in, http://www.redbus.in/, and CTU Musafir app.

author: : Mike Mohundro
title: Carbondale police catch thief taking items with Ring Neighbors app | Crime and Courts | wsiltv.com
text:
CARBONDALE, Ill. -- Police in Carbondale caught a thief taking items from a home thanks to a notification from the Ring Neighbors app.
The Carbondale Police Department said it happened on December 28 in the area of Washington and Hester Streets. Police said they were alerted about a package theft by the Ring Neighbors app.
Police officers and detectives were able to get the photos from the incident and later found a suspect wearing the same clothing.
They also recovered the stolen items and were returned back to the victim.
â€œThe Neighbors app has proven to be a very effective tool in bringing neighbors together by sharing information and creating a sense of community, as well as increasing the chances for a successful criminal investigation when the need arises,â€ Carbondale police stated in a news release. â€œSubscribers to the Neighbors app are not required to notify or communicate with police, and police do not have access to anyoneâ€™s cameras or knowledge of the address or owner information unless it is provided by the owner. Cooperation with law enforcement is strictly voluntary. For more information on the Neighbors app, click the link to the website that provides more details and FAQâ€™s, click here: https://ring.com/neighbors .â€
Download the free WSIL News and Weather apps for the latest stories and alerts sent straight to your mobile device. You may also see us on YouTube for the latest videos.
